snippet: In a long-overdue verdict, a Catholic bishop was found guilty of shielding a priest known to be a threat to children.
abstract: Editorial asserts that the conviction of Bishop Robert Finn for shielding a priest known to be a threat to children is evidence that secular authorities are increasingly willing to venture up the hierarchical ladder in their search for accountability; contends that Catholic officials concerned about church credibility should press for the resignation of Bishop Finn for having abetted the scandal.
lead_paragraph: In a long-overdue verdict, a Catholic bishop was found guilty of shielding a priest known to be a threat to children.

headline.seo: Justice Ventures Up the Church Hierarchy
